Package com._360t.structured.model.template

Interface ProcessorModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Flow.Publisher<MessageModel>, java.util.concurrent.Flow.Subscriber<MessageModel>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientSocketPublisherSubscriber, PlayerProcessor, ServerSocketPublisherSubscriber
    public interface ProcessorModel
extends java.util.concurrent.Flow.Publisher<MessageModel>, java.util.concurrent.Flow.Subscriber<MessageModel>

    Define the overall structure of a message processor class

    This class extends the behaviour of the Flow.Publisher and Flow.Subscriber interfaces, which were introduced in Java 9. Basically, the main idea of the Player App is based on the Java 9 Flow Api package. In essence, this class inherited two behaviours of a processor, publishing and subscribing and inherited from both Publisher and Subscriber interfaces for clarity.

    Since:
    9/7/2020
    Author:
    MohammadReza Ahmadi
    See Also:
    Flow.Publisher, Flow.Subscriber

      default void defaultOnError​(java.lang.Throwable throwable, java.util.logging.Logger logger)
      This method is called through Subscription, Publisher or Subscriber classes when an error occurs, and because it behaves the same in all child classes, it is included as a default method in this interface.
      void setCountDownLatch​(java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch countDownLatch)
      Accepts a CountDownLatch value that controls the number of incoming and outgoing messages per sending cycle.

      Accepts a MessageModel value and when the game starts, the first message will be sent through this method.

      • submit

        void submit​(MessageModel message)
        Accepts a MessageModel value and when the game starts, the first message will be sent through this method. Another implementation that can use this method is that this method is called several times in a loop and sends and receives a message each time.
        Parameters:
        message -
        See Also:
        MessageModel

      • defaultOnError

        default void defaultOnError​(java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                            java.util.logging.Logger logger)
        This method is called through Subscription, Publisher or Subscriber classes when an error occurs, and because it behaves the same in all child classes, it is included as a default method in this interface.
        Parameters:
        throwable - An error object that was passed by the higher class when an exception throws.
        logger - Logger object which pass to this method to print its error log message.
